comments.content: unable to find phrase “ Microsoft Workspace Analytics can analyze network traffic patterns.” anywhere plus it is not workspace analytics but workplace analytics

discussion.content:
Yes, Microsoft Workspace Analytics can analyze network traffic patterns. Microsoft Workspace Analytics is a cloud-based service that provides insights into user productivity and collaboration within organizations. It can collect data from various sources, including network traffic, and provide reports and visualizations to help organizations optimize their use of Microsoft 365 services.

With Microsoft Workspace Analytics, organizations can gain visibility into how their users are using Microsoft 365 services, including network traffic patterns. By analyzing network traffic data, organizations can identify areas where network performance can be improved and optimize network configurations to improve user productivity.

However, it's important to note that Microsoft Workspace Analytics is designed to provide insights into the use of Microsoft 365 services, not to monitor or analyze all network traffic. For more comprehensive network traffic analysis, organizations may need to use specialized network monitoring tools.

comments.content: That article is not specific to Microsoft and does not say anything about using Viva Insights - Workplace Analytics for Network Traffic analysis.

discussion.content:
Answer is correct.

Based here...

What is Workplace Analytics for Collaboration Apps? So what is workplace analytics? Workplace analytics is what enables businesses to use data from various cloud-based platforms such as Slack, Zoom, and Microsoft Teams to identify collaboration patterns that impact productivity and workforce effectiveness.

https://www.unifysquare.com/blog/workplace-analytics/#:~:text=What%20is%20Workplace%20Analytics%20for,impact%20productivity%20and%20workforce%20effectiveness.

choices.E: Enable users to download and install Office 365 ProPlus from the Office 365 portal.
choices.C: Download the Office 365 ProPlus Windows Installer (MSI) package. Install Office 365 ProPlus from a local distribution source.
choices.A: Use System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM) to deploy Office 365 ProPlus from a local distribution source.
choices.B: Use System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM) to deploy Office 365 ProPlus from an Office Windows Installer (MSI) package.
choices.D: Use the Office Deployment Tool (ODT) to download installation files to a local distribution source. Install Office 365 ProPlus by using the downloaded files.

questions.question_text:
A company assigns a Microsoft 365 license to each employee.
You need to install Microsoft Office 365 ProPlus on each employee laptop computer.
Which three methods can you use? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
I think it should be ADE, I don't think we support installing MSI versions for Office ProPlus
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/upgrade-from-msi-version
A. Use System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM) to deploy Office 365 ProPlus from a local distribution source.
D. Use the Office Deployment Tool (ODT) to download installation files to a local distribution source. Install Office 365 ProPlus by using the downloaded files.
E. Enable users to download and install Office 365 ProPlus from the Office 365 portal.

comments.content: but it is ADE according to he answer today unless the answer changed

discussion.content: MSI package for office 365 does not exists - https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/msoffice/forum/all/msi-installer-for-office-365/69e0a0ae-ae67-4a6f-996c-cbc6daaf41e3

Selected Answer: ADE
Answer is correct

comments.content:
Option B states to deploy Office 365 ProPlus from an Office Windows Installer (MSI) package using SCCM. However, Microsoft Office 365 ProPlus is not available as an MSI installer. It uses a Click-to-Run installer instead, which is a different technology.

Option C states to download the Office 365 ProPlus Windows Installer (MSI) package and install it from a local distribution source. This is not possible since, as stated earlier, Microsoft Office 365 ProPlus does not use an MSI installer. Therefore, Option C is not a valid method to install Office 365 ProPlus.

discussion.content:
A. Use System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM) to deploy Office 365 ProPlus from a local distribution source: This is a common method for deploying software to multiple computers in an enterprise environment. SCCM can be used to deploy Office 365 ProPlus to computers on the company network.

D. Use the Office Deployment Tool (ODT) to download installation files to a local distribution source. Install Office 365 ProPlus by using the downloaded files: The Office Deployment Tool (ODT) is a command-line tool that allows administrators to download and deploy Office 365 ProPlus. This method provides more control over the installation process than the Office 365 portal method.

E. Enable users to download and install Office 365 ProPlus from the Office 365 portal: This method allows users to download and install Office 365 ProPlus directly from the Office 365 portal. This method is suitable for small organizations with fewer IT resources or organizations that allow users to work from home or remote locations.

Selected Answer: ADE
ADE is correct

This is ADE for sure
https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/msoffice/forum/all/msi-installer-for-office-365/69e0a0ae-ae67-4a6f-996c-cbc6daaf41e3:
"Yes, there isn't MSI installer for Office 365"
ADE would be correct

A, D, E correct (B & C both are incorrect as O365 Proplus doesn’t have MSI (only .exe))
Here correct Ans is A,D, and E

BDE because MSI isn't how we install it. This single details disqualifies two options, leaving the three that are correct.

discussion.content:
ADE
If you do deploy with Configuration Manager, we recommend deploying from a local source, using your Configuration Manager distribution points.
For organizations that don't have Configuration Manager but still want to manage their deployment, we recommend using the Office Deployment Tool (ODT).
You can also manage your deployment from the Office portal and have your users install Office on their client devices directly from the portal.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/plan-microsoft-365-apps

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/DeployOffice/plan-microsoft-365-apps#step-1---choose-how-to-deploy
A. Use System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM) to deploy Office 365 ProPlus from a local distribution source.
D. Use the Office Deployment Tool (ODT) to download installation files to a local distribution source. Install Office 365 ProPlus by using the downloaded files.
E. Enable users to download and install Office 365 ProPlus from the Office 365 portal
answer A,D,E
There is no Windows Installer (.msi) package that users can download and install for Office 365 ProPlus.

comments.content: Windows Installer technology (MSI) was used to install the volume license editions of older versions of Office 2016 and older, such as Microsoft Office Professional Plus and Microsoft Office Standard

This gives you full control over the update deployment process, e.g. when which devices will receive a specific update."
